page.title: 13HISTORIC PLACES 1
page.content: {SOUTH HILL PARK Built 1760.30 acres of common land were enclosed within its park. George Canning bought the house in the early 19th century and William Pitt who had been Britain's youngest Prime Minister used to visit him.The estate was sold many times until 1853 when the Hauter family lived in it up to the 1st World War.Since then the mansion has had many different occupants,including the Royal Sea Bathing Hospital,the BBC and Ferranti. It is now an Arts Centre and a theatre has been built onto it. {EASTHAMPSTEAD CHURCH (St.Michaels) Built 19th Century.The lower half of the tower is older than the rest.The pulpit is dated 1631.There is some fine woodwork which was brought from Oxford Cathedral.Some of the stained glass windows are by Burne-Jones. S.Bull,J.Simner,D.Rowbotham,E.Park 3yr
